description:
Sonic Rush is a 2.5D platformer for the Nintendo DS from 2005.
It's the game that introduced Blaze the Cat and the boost ability.

0.1.0.description:
# Changelog

## APWorld
### Gameplay
- Items:
  - Zone unlocks for each zone (including F-Zone) for each character (a few always as starting items)
  - Progressive level selects for each character
    - Receiving x progressive level selects for a character makes you able to access all zones from 1 to x, but only if you can actually enter one of those zones
  - All chaos and sol emeralds
  - Extra lives for each character (filler)
  - Halving the extra lives of each character (trap)
  - Tails and Cream Unlock/Kidnap (one-time filler/trap)
- Locations:
  - All acts and bosses of each zone (uncluding F-Zone and Extra Zone) for each character
  - (Optinal) Reaching S rank on each act and boss of each zone (**ex**cluding F-Zone and Extra Zone) for each character
  - Special stages
- Goals:
  - Defeat all main game bosses (not Extra Zone) at least once
  - Defeat all main game bosses with both characters
  - Clear Extra Zone
  - 100% (Defeat all main game bosses with both characters and clear Extra Zone)
- Options:
  - Goal
  - Screw F-Zone (exclude Bomber Barbara from goal condition and having progressive items)
  - Traps percentage
  - Amount of random starting zones
  - Include S rank checks
  - Tails and Cream substory (see yaml for details)
### Known bugs
- Generation failures on low starting zone amount

## Rom
### Gameplay
- See above
- Extra Zone won't require you to play all of the main story anymore, but all emeralds instead
### QoL
- Zone map completely accessible from start, but can't enter acts before unlocked
### Technicalities
- Added exception to early arm9 whiteout (to be able to put custom code in arm9)
### Known bugs
- Tails and Cream showing up in boss fights and talking even when not present
- Corruption going down after returning to overworld
- Freeze after Sonic zone 5 boss (reported by Discord@gurglemurgle after release)

## Is this version compatible with older save files?
- No backwards compatibility, as this is the first version
0.1.0.title: v0.1.0 (initial release)

0.1.1.description:
# Changelog
The debug version is intended as a try to debug the very random client malfunctioning problem. I can't guarantee that it's fixed. However, it should always be used instead of the initial 0.1.1 release. Don't forget to rename it back to `sonic_rush.apworld`, or else it won't be loaded by the AP software.

## APWorld
### QoL
- Added item groups: `Zone Unlocks (Sonic/Blaze)`, `Emeralds`, `Chaos/Sol Emeralds`
### Docs
- Added Docs
### Bug fixes
- (Hopefully) Fixed item receiving issues
- Fixed a typo in checking the zone 4 boss with Blaze (Discord@thegreenviper8)
- Fixed zone access logic
- Fixed boss S rank locations not getting checked if the option was set to `only_bosses` (0.1.1-debug only)
### Technicalities
- Changed save data setup complete flag to 0x6b
- Reworked client sending received items to the game
- Replaced every `add_rule` with `set_rule`
- Tweaked item filling to reduce generation failures
- Removed path generating in spoiler

## Rom
### Bug fixes
- Sol emeralds appearing sometimes as fully collected (Discord@thegreenviper8)
- Freezes after defeating some main game bosses (Discord@gurglemurgle)
- Extra Zone freezing after a few seconds (Discord@kangdide)
- Freezes after defeating F-Zone (and apparently Extra Zone too) (Discord@thegreenviper8)
- Zone accessibility changing after defeating any boss
### Technicalities
- visual emeralds now set by calculating function instead of manually when loading overworld
- Removed overlay0001 extension and moved custom functions to arm9
- Included checking for F-Zone and Extra Zone in zone transitioning function (+ corrected using actual zone index instead of location index)
- Capping of first 0xFF part of save data disabled

## Is this version compatible with older multiworld slots and save files?
- ~~Yes, but you must clear your save data using the in-game options
  **No items will be lost, as the client resyncs them**~~ No due to changing the save data initialization flag
0.1.1.title: v0.1.1

0.1.2.description:
# Changelog

## APWorld
### Bug fixes
- (Hopefully) Fixed backwards compatibility issues (Discord@probackup.8048, Discord@limited_fears)
- Fixed client not working at all (in 0.1.1-debug) due to a mistyped import (@Knuxfan24)
### Technicalities
- Changed save data initialization check to sonic's storyprog not being 0

## Rom
None

## Is this version compatible with older multiworld slots and save files?
- 0.1.1 Yes
- 0.1.0 No
0.1.2.title: v0.1.2

0.1.3.description:
# Changelog

## APWorld
### Bug fixes
- Fixed client crashing because of checking slot data too early
- Fixed chaos emeralds not properly receiving when in level with Sonic
### Technicalities
- Added waiting for slot data
- Added validation check for patched rom

## Rom
None

## Is this version compatible with older multiworld slots and save files?
Hopefully (back to 0.1.1)
0.1.3.title: v0.1.3

0.2.0.description:
# Changelog

## APWorld
### Gameplay
- Added DeathLink
- Added `Menu` location (always accessible)
- Reworked item and location names
- Merged zone unlocks to one per location (`Leaf Storm`, `Water Palace`, ...)
  - This also changes maximum starting zones in options
  - This also changes logic slightly
### Docs
- Small tweaks and typo fixes
- Added UT to optional software
### Bug fixes
- Fixed extra lives not being received properly in-level
- Fixed high rate of generation failures
  - This was done by forcing `Dead Line` (Zone 7) to always be a starting zone
### Technicalities
- Stored reoccuring string lists and dictionaries in new data file
- Removed item creation tweaking for lowering generation failures
- Other small tweaks to reduce boilerplate code
- Removed validation check for patched rom
- Tweaked item classifications

## Rom
### Gameplay
- Added DeathLink
### Technicalities
- Added functions for receiving and sending deathlink
- Now using another AP storage byte for deathlink flags

## Is this version compatible with older multiworld slots and save files?
No
0.2.0.title: v0.2.0 (The "Dead Zones" update)

0.2.2.description:
# Changelog

## APWorld
### Gameplay
- Reverted Dead Line always being a starting zone
### Docs
- Small wording changes
### Bug fixes
- Fixed all zone access rules being the same as Dead Line (Discord@rhythmic.rugan)
  - This also caused the whole game being sphere 1
  - This also caused the high generation failure rate in previous versions
### Technicalities
- Changed client to use item and location lookups from datapackage

## Rom
No changes

## Is this version compatible with older multiworld slots and save files?
Only back to 0.2.0
0.2.2.title: v0.2.2
